identity of his development of the formalism and matrix mechanics. SchrÃ¶dinger

Copenhagen interpretation of quantum mechanics (using e.g. the paradox of
SchrÃ¶dinger's cat). In addition, he was the author of many works in various
fields of physics: statistical mechanics and thermodynamics, physics of

and he made several attempts to construct a unified field theory. In his book
[[What Is Life?]] SchrÃ¶dinger addressed the problems of genetics, looking at
